author: Niallskie
title: Gold gold everywhere...
review:
Just finished building this set, was quite happy with this set. Apparently I'm happy with all the PotC set I have build and those I haven't yet, LOL. Very happy when I opened the set, the instuction and poster has a backing board. I just recently build 4192 Fountain of Youth and was disappointed that it has no backing board and the instructions and poster was folded. Very happy that this one has them, maybe on the set 4192 was a fluke, but this time I dont have a PotC card??? Im assuming all the sets have a character card.

 

The build took me a couple of minutes, and it was alright. I do love the turning wall that turns Barbossa to his skeleton look. I am not sure if these parts are from the Ninjago, but I love the arms and skeleton legs with boots. Dont know why they did not do that to the skeleton at 4192. Minifigures are awesome, would have been nice if there's a fifth figures (but dont we all want extra figure: :D ). Would also be nice if there a couple of difference to the Jack Sparrow minifigures from different sets, as far as I can see most of them has the same torso, but different faces are awesome. On this set Jack has his zombie face or death face. I also love the new gold bar, there a good addition as it serves as gold bars and a linking brick. Much better if it was the usual gold chrome though.

 

All in all this set is wonderful and always worth collecting. Price could have been lowered to $15, but having it for $20 is good enough. Im sure there are loyalty fee's that lego themselves have to pay for this licensed sets. Gonna be waiting for coming deals with local stores so I can have extra sets. Now go get this sets everybody. :D

author: scorpion_156
title: soooooooooooo much gold
review:
lets get straight to the point yeah
this set is awesome pros and cons are now coming
Pros
lots of gold for treasure
nice boat
four mini figures with cool faces torsos legs hair accessories
nice little building with a body changer from hector barbossa to skeleton barbossa

Cons
none really.

Overall
Great set nice mini figures island and treasure
worth every penny

author: David1971
title: Lots of nice bits including a Lego Keira Knightley!
review:
Although not especially a fan of the Pirates of the Caribbean movies, I thought this would be a nice Lego theme. And it is! For my first set, I wanted to get one of the two £20 sets, and based on minifigures, this one was the winner, as you get the nice female figure, Elizabeth Swann, as well as a Jack Sparrow, plus the pirate Hector Barbossa.

(You also get a skeleton version of Barbossa, which I'm afraid, like some of the more rubbish droids in Star Wars sets, I don't really count as a proper minifig).

So the three main minifigs are all very nicely done, with lots of detail. Does the Elizabeth Swann minifig look like Keira Knightley? Well yes, sort of, in the Lego way. It's certainly not a bad likeness. And Captain Jack has printing all over and a very good piratey hairpiece.

The rest of the set has some interesting bits and bobs - nice to get two apples, swords, boat, etc. It's quite a good little play scene.

Incidentally the reviewer Niallskie (review posed on 20 April 2011) says that they built the set in "a couple of minutes". I have to say, that's nonsense. It's not a big set, but even if you were really *racing* to build it ... well it just wouldn't be possible to do it in two minutes. That's ridiculous. You just can't physically click together 152 pieces, following the instructions, in that time. I built the set at a moderate pace, enjoying the process but not going especially slowly, but not rushing either, and it takes a pleasant 25-30 minutes.

Of course, it's quite expensive for what you get, but, once you're used to Lego pricing, it's not bad. Ideally it should be a £15 set rather than a £20 set. No stickers, though; lots of nice detail; and they even bothered to put the poster and instructions in a bag with tough board so that they don't get bent or bashed up in the box, which is a nice touch.

So overall, I did enjoy this set.

author: MovieNerd
title: Why couldn't the gold be chrome?
review:
Honestly I was really looking forward the the gold chrome bars that appeared to be coming with this set and yet imagine my surprise when I opened this set up to discover they were a dull flat gold color instead. I was disappointed more then I should be, but still if they are chrome in all of the photos and on the BOX for crying out loud, then they should be chrome when I open the box.

Also I was just expecting more from this set, just something bigger for the amount of time they spend there in the movie and how important it is to the plot. I'm just wishing there was more to this set. I was also a little disappointed in the non-skeleton Barbossa figure. I think he should have gotten a hair/hat piece like some of the Jack minifigs do, because his face just doesn't look right without the long hair that the character had. Also why couldn't they have painted the neck of the skeleton side of Jack's face white? That way you could have added him to a skeleton body too to fight skeleton Barbossa.

I do like the Elizabeth figure and the Skeleton Barbossa figure too (the "boots" on the feet are a nice touch). It's also cool that they included a boat in the set as well. Also bravo to LEGO for including the plastic protected and carboard backed poster and instructions in even one of the smaller sets. The smaller boxes are nice too.

It's a decent little set, but I am hoping they make something bigger further down the line of this theme lasts.

author: HWR1996
title: changing opinions!
review:
When i got this set yesterday i was amazed at how small it really was.

 

Minifigs:

Skellie Barbossa:

Comes with an apple, a sword strap, (which doesnt really stay put on a skellies shoulder)

An apple, and a sword. Also the same hat as the other barbossa.

8/10 The ninjago legs spoil it a bit

 

Skellie Jack:

My first jack proves to be a good one. It makes the set somewhat worth it, and has a skellie face as well as a normal one.

It comes with a compass, and a sword ( from this review onwards ill refer as normal equipment)

10/10

 

Normal barbossa:

Comes with the same as his counterpart above. The torso and legs have printing, and look amazing, as does the hat

10/10

 

Elisabeth swan:

The worst minifig in the range. It doesnt even look like keira knightly (apologies for misspellings) much like the hermione from the 2010 releases

The dress and hair though are saving grace for the minifig

5/10

 

The set:

Its not much to look at, however, there is a spinning play feature to change barbossa, which works well! There is also a small archway where the boat goes, there is also lots of treasure, especially in the aztec chest, with new coins. (currently unless im mistaken, exclusive to the set!) Even though the set is small you can make MOCS or customise it!

Even with its drawbacks, the set isnt as bad as it seems!

I added a few templates and made the scene much bigger, it allowed fighting space for the main characters, i just used big plates, and stuck the chest in the middle!

 

Oh, and the treasure?

Not exactly shiny shiny, but im happy to get the new coins!

The set: 77/100

The ship sail play feature is a pointless waste of build time, but moc pieces, or moccing the set itself make it worth its value, as well as the excellent minifigures!

 

HWR1996 signing out!

author: BrickFan5
title: Your off the edge of the map mate, Here there be monsters! - Hector Barbossa
review:
Great addition to start of the new theme. Comes with great detailed minifigures.

The Cove itself is split into two pieces, One side with the Chest of Cortes; Which includes 8 cold coins (Not 882 as in the film :D), It has room to stand one minifig so you can re-enact the final duel or the capture of Elizabeth.

The second and largest piece consists of some water where you can row in with your boat. It can be sealed by pushing the lever which sends a mast toppling down which closes the entrance. As you pass some shiny treasure (Coins and gold bars), you reach the transformation wheel where you place Barbossa on each side, And turn it asif the moonlight had triggered the curse.

Minifigures:

Captain Jack Sparrow: With swashbuckling detail on all body pieces, Including the unique hair piece which holds a lot of detail with the bandana and little trinkets. The torso is identical with the film holding much detail in the print. His face has a determined grin. When you turn his head, he too becomes a cursed skeleton; though a seperate body piece is not incluuded, His accessories are his sword, and trusty compass (2 are included).

Captain Hector Barbossa: With a grand coat printed right down to the legs, He is unmistakably the most detailed figure in the set, Nice hat with blue feather, And an uncut beard as his face, His accessories are a sword, Green apple, And a new bandoleer to hold his cutlass in place.

Cursed Barbossa: Mad up of Ninjago skeleton piece, He has a more rib-like feel to him, Legs with little black boots, and long, smooth arms, He has the same face as normal barbossa, apart from its white with grey hair. Accessories are identical to normal Barbossa.

Elizabeth Swann/Turner: Nice hair, Long and light brown, Gown comes into a proper dress piece for legs, with printed detail from top to bottom. The head is two-faced, One with a rather smug smile, the second is a screaming, Or if next to the chest it's more like "YOU FOUND ME TREASURE"

Overall it's a nice little set to begin your POTC theme, I would recommend this to anyone who likes the films.

Pros:

Captain Barbossa (My favorite)

Jack Sparrow

Elizabeth Swann

Cursed Barbossa

Row Boat

Chest of Cortes

Transformation base.

Treasure

Cons:

Will Turner?

author: legoclone999
title: Love It, But No Will?
review:
I bought this set from TRU and was very pleased with it. It was $20, a good price for the parts and minifigures

Minifigures

The minifigures were great save for two things. I found it odd that Skeleton Jack was only the face, although I guess too many minifigures would raise the price and make it necessary to add more pieces. I also, like most, am sad there is no Will, but like I said with Jack, that would be too many minifigs.

Parts 

I liked all the parts, except for the fact I thought the gold coins would be shiny like the old ones, but were instead dull gold. I liked the new boat, very similar to the previous boat. The grey column piece was a nice addition because I had not bought any Atlantis sets with those pieces.

author: legoDad42
title: Island of Death!
review:
Recreating a scene/cavern from The Curse of the Black Pearl, Pirates of the Caribbeans' Isla De Muerta is one great playset. For the amount of pieces the playability is extremely high, the mini-figs are fabulous(!) and you get a nice poster to boot(y)...;)

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4629-1.jpg[/img]

Parts of Interest...Parts I like...or BOTH!

Some great-new parts here, notably the compass pieces (printed graphics), shoulder strapped sword holders and pearl-gold bars. Though, the coins and gold bars aren't chrome-gold like they appear on the box art. From what some have said, contact Lego's customer service and I believe they'll replace the coins and gold bars to their chrome versions for ya'(have to try this myself).

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4610-1.jpg[/img]

Rowboat details...

The rowboat is one solid piece, brown hull with some basic, added bricks for the latern and seats plus 2 notches in front to hold the oars upright and rowlocks on both sides.

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4625-1.jpg[/img]

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4621-1.jpg[/img]

 

Cavern details...

You get a recreation of the cavern in the film with a partial cave entrance with water, adorned throughout with gems/jewels and a chest. Also there's a trap plus a transformation chamber...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4636-1.jpg[/img]

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4637-1.jpg[/img]

Chest of Cortes...

The cursed chest of Aztec gold given to the conquistador Hernan Cortes to appease him and stop his slaughter of the heathen Aztec people...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4619-1.jpg[/img]

...now within are 882 pieces of Aztec gold (actually Lego gives ya' 10 pieces dangit), and if any mortal takes merely one coin, a terrible curse be put upon ye' (see transformation chamber)!

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4620-1.jpg[/img]

Transformation chamber...

Here we have Hector Barbossa (who just loves apples), duly cursed since taking many a coin from the Chest of Cortes in this nicely designed, brick-built 'transformation chamber'...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4623-1.jpg[/img]

...what's this(!?), upon being bathed in moonlight (and using the new column piece atop the chamber to turn it), any of the cursed transform into their wretched-rotting skeletal selves. Note that the cursed are immortal, so they've at least got that goin' for them...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4624-1.jpg[/img]

Falling Mast trap...

At the rear side of the kit is a technic pin mounted low with the mast above it...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4633-1.jpg[/img]

...tap it quickly and the mast flings over to block the cave entrance. Or use it to smash your foes and/or trap/damage the rowboat...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4634-1.jpg[/img]

MINI-FIGS!

Truly beautiful figs here (and I'm not just talkin' Lego Johnny Depp...swooon).

Here are Jack Sparrow and Elizabeth Swann. Just notice all the detailed graphics on the figures, exquisite(yet I notice that Jack's face color doesn't match his exposed chest/torso tone)...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4639-1.jpg[/img]

...and here are their duel faces. Zombie Jack (love this face) and Horrified Swann...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4641-1.jpg[/img]

Jack Sparrow and Elizabeth Swann back shots...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4657-1.jpg[/img]

Now we have Hector Barbossa and his cursed-self, Skeleton Barbossa. Great graphics on Hector's figure...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4643-1.jpg[/img]

Poster...

Great to see the instructions packed along with the bonus poster in a polybag and cardboard. Not sure if this is a norm for future kits all around but I suspect it'll only be done when a kit includes a special poster or print...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4611-1.jpg[/img]

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4612-1.jpg[/img]

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4614-1.jpg[/img]

...the code you see below is to be used in Lego Pirates of the Caribbean video games to unlock special content...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN4615-1.jpg[/img]

Summary...

I highly recommend picking up this small play-kit. Even at a low piece count for $20.00, it's not a terrible price since you get so many cool, new accessories, fun set and just incredible mini-figs. This appeals to all Lego collectors from the young builder through to the parts for the Moc'ers and Mod'ers out there. Pick one up now!

author: AETerry
title: Isla de la Muerta Review
review:
When the PoTC movies first came out, a liscensed deal with Mega Bloks had been made, so any brick sets available at that time were all Mega Blok brand and just horrible looking. And I remember shaking my head and going I have plenty of LEGO Pirate sets already, I'll stick with those.

 

With Stranger Tides coming out, a new liscense deal is out and its with LEGO and I have to say, with the box art they look great and on opening a set to build, I am further not disappointed. The sets aren't just for Stranger Tides, but earlier PoTC movies as Isla de la Muerta shows. A scene right out of Curse of the Black Pearl.

 

There are 4 minifigures - Captain Jack Sparrow, Elizabeth Swann, Hector Barbossa (all three of whom are magnificinent and look worthy of something out of the Collectible Minifigures line) and Skeleton Barbossa who's my least favorite and meh. Barbossa is wearing a new accessory in the way of the musketeer style hat and a scabard for his cutlass that you can fit into it.

 

The main set is alright, the mast has a push lever on it so you can make a trap out of it and the turn table that Barbossa stands on allows for play when the moonlight hits him and he turns into a skeleton. There's lots of matte' or pearl gold pieces, chalice and a gemstone for the treasure that's laying around in the cave. A chest that even more gold and gold bars are found in. What I am disappointed by here is the picture shows the gold bars and coins to be chrome gold, not that matte' or pearl gold coloring. The gold crystal cluster I like the look of, it's more metalic and better then the gold crystal gotten from the Pharoah's Quest theme - Scarab Attack set.

 

The final piece(s) is the rowboat, it's the same design in all the other Pirate themes that LEGO has done, so no need to reinvent the wheel, perhaps just a change of color choices for the benches that people sit on.

 

It's a fun little set, either for play or for Collectibilty and comes in at around $19.99 for the set, so it's not too bad for number of pieces, liscense, unique pieces, extra pieces and the minifigure detail work.

author: wander099
title: Pearl gold instead of chrome gold
review:
Box/Instructions

Like the other sets in this theme, the box has been made smaller in comparison to the size of the set.  However, this is not a problem as there is ample room inside to store the bricks included.  The instructions consist of a single booklet and are placed in protective cardboard sheath along with the poster.  As a result they are not bent or mangled.  However, this is not the case in all POTC sets.

Parts

There are many excellent parts included in this set.  For instance, there is a large row boat, blue flames (not transparent and used on Barbossa's hat). You also get two of Jack's compass and an extra sword, as well as a brand new piece to allow minifigures to carry a sword as if in a sheath.

It is supposed to include chrome gold coins and bars, but my set came with pearl ones, which was a big disappointment.  This is my main complaint about this set.

Minifigures

This set comes with four minifigures: Jack Sparrow, Hector Barbossa, skeleton Hector Barbossa, and Elizabeth Swann.  I think this set should have come with Will Turner as he was in the scene and a key character at that.

Jack Sparrow is excellent.  His hair and bandanna are one large piece and his head is double-sided with one side being his normal face and the other side being his skeleton face.  His torso and legs are the same as the other versions of Jack, it is very accurate to the movie, and there is back printing on the torso.

Hector Barbossa is also great.  His hat is very well done and has the blue flame as a feather.  His head is not double-sided, there is printing on both sides of his torso and on the front of his legs.  He also comes with a sword sheath, a sword, and an apple.

The skeleton version of Barbossa comes with the same accessories as the regular minifigure.  The body and feet are like the new Ninjago skeletons.  The head is white and has a similar face to the other Barbossa minifigure, except this one has an evil grin, grey circles around the eyes, and cheek bones.

The Elizabeth Swann minifigure is wearing the red dress Barbossa gave her from the first movie and has the aztec gold necklace printed on her torso.  Her head is double-sided and her angry/scared face looks rather odd.  But still an okay minifigure (if you don't use the odd face).

The build

The build is quite easy and short as would be expected with this size set.  However, attention to detail is required because misplacement of some of the smaller pieces is easy to do.

The completed model

The completed model has a couple of play features.  First, there is the platform that spins so that the Barbossa figures can be switched to 'transform' him into skeleton version.  The other feature is the mast, which can be made to fall across the entrance area.  This feature only works so-so as the horizontal part of the mast can rotate and get in the way.

The treasure chest with the Aztec gold is well designed.  Just like in the movie it is a separate island from the rest and has a lid that can be removed completely or slid partially off.  All the coins can be stored inside.  If Will Turner was included, then this set would include everything needed to re-enact the scenes from the Isla de Muerta in the movie.

Summary

I recommend this set to older children and adults who are fans of Pirates of the Caribbean and want all the characters.  This set includes exclusive minifigures that are required if you want to collect the main characters.  It is the only set that includes Elizabeth Swann and Barbossa from the first three movies.  Also, Jack's skeleton face and the skeleton version of Barbossa are pretty good too.

I would not recommend this set for children because it lacks playability and other sets in the theme would be more appealing to children because there are more play features in them (for example, the cannibal escape).  There are also many small pieces some of which are not directly attached to the main model (ex. coins) and would be easy for a child to lose.

The only cons aside from playability are that this set should have included Will Turner because he was an important character in this scene and the coins/bars should have been made in chrome gold as they appeared to be on the box and in pictures online.

author: K_nut
title: Couldn't resist...
review:
Told you I'd be back with more Potc reviews!

Minifigs

Captain Jack is identical to the one in the mill except for the head. The head has the skelly on one side and the fighting/constipated face. Nice fig. Elizabeth Swann is a beautiful fig. She has to faces, weird grin and scared. Suits the figure really well. Skelly Barbossa. Two words, Extra parts. Good figure, just has no uses and has REALLY good parts. My favorite figure of the bunch, Human Barbossa. A former musketeer, (apparently, I mean look at the hat) Barbossa has a black the scabbard, beautiful face, and beautiful designs on his torso and legs. Figures get 4.5/5 from me.

Boat

It's brown. What more can I say?

Chest

Complete with pearl gold, (NOT in chrome gold like the box shows) the chest is simple, but nice looking.

Main Structure

The main structure, starting from the left, is a little entryway. it has just enough space to fit the boat. There's a little button thingy that makes the broken mast a trap. (Lego's running out of play feature ideas :/)  The turning mechanism is good but kind of pointless. 

Conclusion

Overall, a good set. Gets a solid B+. Only thing they should've changed is include Will instead of skelly Barbossa. Just include skelly Barbossa'a head like you did with the Series 2 Mime Lego!

author: CloneEcho
title: Pirates!
review:
This set is about in the middle of how good the POTC sets rating, its got a cool little boat and cave, good if you bought two for a bigger cave. 

PROS

  • new Barbossa Minifig
  • new Elizibeth Swan Minifig
  • new Barbossa skeleton Minifig
  • cool row boat
  • lots of gold
  • cool feature with changing Barbossa into skeleton 

CONS

  • dull gold
  • wrong Elizabeth (in the movie she has withe pants and a red jacket) 

This set gets a 4.1 because it needs Will Turner to lift the curse, a skeleton pirate, a Jack Sparrow skeleton like Barbossa, and Jack the monkey. Also the gold looks way more shiney on the box than in the set, and the mast, what the heck is up with the mast it wasent even in the in the movie! The poster is cool, it has a picture of Jack and Barbossa (skeleton) dualing and Elizibeth is just standing there while Will (why is he in the poster?) takes aztec gold from the chest, the other side is just like the others with the map and voodoo doll Jack code on the back. I think it should have came with the minifigs i mentiond and a bigger cave, it should be $30 with the extra stuff then it would be a good set.

author: dougts
title: Good Parts Set - Mine came with "shiny" gold
review:
I bought this set mainly for parting out, as there are a lot of little trinkets and accessories that can fine there way into various uses.  I've read many complaints that the gold bars/coins were the "pearl" variety and not the "chrome" variety, but I can happily say that mine were the chrome "shiny" kind. Not sure if TLG purposely changed the production along the way, or if one or the other kind were used up before proceeding to the new inventory. Regardless, I've read numerous times that you can call customer service and they will send you the shiny kind.

Pros

  • Rowboat
  • Shiny gold bars/coins (if you got the shiny ones)
  • 3.5 minifigures (I can't really count skeleton)
  • compass
  • apples
  • swivel brick
  • jewel
  • swords/sheaths/etc.

Cons

  • dull gold bars/coins (unless you got the shiny ones)
  • Elizabeth has the terrible slope brick legs

Not terrible from a playability perspective for a small set.  you get the changing Barbosa as well as Jack and Elizabeth, along with the rotating changing platform and the clever and effective mast trap.

Not much to the build really, all parts can easily be done with only a reference picture.  As an accessories pack, there's plenty to like here

author: Bard_the_Bowman
title: I feel...cold    -Hector Barbossa
review:
When I first got this set, I didn't think it was that cool.  This review proves that I was wrong. 

 

Jack Sparrow:  There is nothing really special about Jack, but he does have a new head piece:  one side with him snarling and another side with his cursed face.

 

Elizabeth Swann:  This minifig is Elizabeth in her red dress(given to her from Barbossa) from the first movie.  Her hair would be great for a custom minifig.

 

Hector Barbossa:  Barbossa has alot of cool pieces .   1.  The collectable series 4 musketeer minifig's hat.  2.  A green apple (this makes sense if you have watched the first movie).  3.  One of those new sword holder pieces.

 

Skeleton Barbossa:  Cursed form of Barbossa. He should have some clothes on!

Rowboat:  This is just a normal rowboat with a lamp in front and two benches in it.

 

Chest of Cortes:  The chest has alot of gold pieces including a gold crystal,  gold studs, a gold bar, and features a sliding top to reveal the cursed Aztec gold coins inside.

 

Isla de Muerta:  The Isla has a part that is water where it features a mast in the back and you push on a Technic pin, and the mast falls and a land part where it features a function where you put Barbossa in the front and Skeleton Barbossa in the back and you can rotate it using one of those new column pieces in Atlantis to make it look like Barbossa is turning into a skeleton.  It is all littered with gold.

 

 

This proves that this set is way cooler than I imagined it!

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Pirates of the Caribbean - Isla de la Muerta Review
review:
This set is a great set to have and very fun to play with as well. The build is very easy and we also don't get any stickers to worry about. Three of these minifigs we get here are exclusive to this set now: We get Elizabeth Swann, Hector Barbossa in skeleton version and the Jack Sparrow figure with the skull on the back of his face. We also get a secret place where you can hide some gold and we also get a boat with a lantern on the front. The island itself is very cool as well. The rock does sviwel full 360° and on the back of the island you can see a button which you can use to push the mast down. There's also lot's of gold laying around but the gold is not shiny for some reason. But it's still a fun set to have for sure.

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: The_Brick_Master
title: Finally!  A New Jack Facial Expression.
review:
I got this set today after seeing "On Stranger Tides" and thought that I'd reveiw it.

Box

4/5

The box is great except for one thing:it shows SHINEY gold coins and bars, NOT pearl gold. Actually, though, it doesn't matter because they match the other "gold" coins and cup.

Parts

5/5

So much gold! (and other parts, too)  A rowboat, A NEW JACK FACIAL EXPRESSION, apples, muskateer hats and more.

Minifigures

5/5

All minifigs are exclusive here. Barbossa (non-solider), Skeleton Barbossa(his sword sheath doesn't stay still, though), Elizabeth, and Jack (WITH A NEW FACIAL EXPRESSION!)

The build

5/5

The build is normal for a $20 set. What more is there to say?

The completed model

5/5

The playability is great with this set, only one weird thing: why is there a jewel in the water?

Summary

Four Words:

 

Get.

 

This.

 

Set.

 

Soon.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Note: Works well with the zombies from "The Captains Cabin" and Will Turner.

author: Legonat
title: He didn't waste his shot...
review:
So I went to Wall-Mart hoping to buy the new LEGO Star Wars videogame when this set caught my eye. I had to get it, not only did I love the movie and the scene, but the figs would inspire some really cool MOCs. First of all, I must say, buy two of this set to get the most playability out of it (them?). Add white hands to Mortal Barbossa and put Cursed Barbossa's head and hat on and you've got a nicer looking Cursed Barbossa. "You can't beat me, Jack." -Hector Barbossa. Buy the tiny $3.49 soldier set from Pirates II theme (if you can find it) and remove the yellow hands, add Elizabeth's, remove the head, add Elizabeth's and you've got a more realistic Elizabeth. " Do you like pain? Try wearing a corset!" -Elizabeth Swann. Add white hands to Cursed Jack for maximum realistic-ness. "I couldn't resist, mate." -Jack Sparrow. You might also want to add Will Turner and some other crew mates to the scene. There for better minifigs. Time to move on...
The biggest fault I find in this set is: Where's all the gold? I mean, the Cursed Aztec Gold haul consisted of over a thousand doubloons inside it (although LEGO would go half bankrupt if they added that many coins to the set) they sure could have added more coins instead of the 1 x 1 pearl gold studs. I personally got eight gold coins in pearl gold to add to the chest. The next con is: Where's Will? He was there the whole time in the scene. Would it have killed LEGO to add a fourth minifig? I doubt it. I'm hopeful we will be seeing many more POTC sets with more figs to add to this set.

author: CapnRex101
title: 4181 - Isla De La Muerta
review:
In the first Pirates of the Caribbean movie, there were a couple of scenes which were memorable for a long time. This was one of them, the long and wild duel between the two immortals, Jack Sparrow and Hector Barbossa. It was bound to be turned into a Lego set, and at this price point, I think this is as good as they could make it. In my opinion it would have been done better if there were more to it, but that would of course in turn raise the price. In case you are not familiar with the Lego design process, this is how it goes, each designer is given a model they need to create and a price for which it will have to sell, occasionally they are not given a guide price and can just go crazy (the UCS Millennium Falcon was an example of that). This set really needed only one thing, a more substantial model at a higher price. Nevertheless, I am here to review the set which we got, so here goes...

Box/Instructions

The box shows the set laid out on a rocky background, like the caves from the film. There is some water where the rowing boat is floating and we can see the skeletal cursed Barbossa peeking out from behind the rock formations. In the corner is a line up of the four Minifigures included in the set which are all great, and all exclusive! 

The instructions were fine, no mistakes that I could find and no missing pieces either. They were packed in a plastic bag like in all of the other Pirates of the Caribbean sets, but this set does not come with a card, they are only in On Stranger Tides sets. The poster is fairly small, and actually does not show the main part of the set, it shows only the figures and the chest, as well as some random other Aztec gold. For some reason Will Turner is on the poster too standing by the treasure chest, although he is not included.

Parts

One of the best things about this set is the parts selection in my opinion. I love the number of gold pieces, goblets, studs, gold jumper plates, a lump of gold ore, two new gold bars and lots of coins (which were shiny gold for me). The light grey curved support structure piece is fantastic, I for one have not seen this part in this colour before, and it could be very useful! Sadly we only get one, which alone cannot really be used for anything. We get a couple of new sword sheaths in black, two green apples, a light grey blade and a gem I have not seen before in this colour, a sort of translucent light blue. All of the grey slope pieces could be useful too.

Minifigures

The other element of this set I adore is the Minifigures. All four of them are totally exclusive to the Isla de la Muerta, my particular favourite is the regular Hector Barbossa figure which is not only a great character to have due to his importance throughout the films, but also because of the excellent detail, he wears a rather extravagant hat which was also seen with the Musketeer from Series 5 of the Collectable Minifigures but in this model the hat has a blue feather, his torso has front and back printing of his long jacket and his legs have a continuation of his torso printing. He also has a sword and a sheath for it. The Cursed  Barbossa is quite a good figure too, with the same hat as the regular Barbossa, a skeletal version of his face with his beard, the rest of the Minifigure is made up of Ninjago skeleton pieces, the new torso, the new legs with boots, and the new arms. He also has a sword and sheath.

Then we have the two heroes, first is Jack Sparrow, who in this set is different to all of his other incarnations with a determined expression on his face and a skeleton face on the reverse, in this set he is without his hat. Next we have Elizabeth Swann, who has a lovely hairpiece, seen on Syrena the mermaid in brown, but this time in a sort of ginger/blonde colour. Her torso has front and back printing and instead of legs she has a printed slope piece as her dress. Both are very nice figures, I hope they release Elizabeth in other outfits in future, if they continue the theme that is.

The build

The build is fairly short and simple, about 20 minutes, no really different building techniques but I really think this is more of a set for younger children, so an easy build is good for them. It has given me some new ideas on how to construct good looking rock formations, which are notoriously difficult to make.

The completed model

When finished the final product is small and somewhat spindly. There is really not a lot to it, but for such a tiny bit of scenery they have really packed in the features. We have a falling mast, which is quite a fun feature, not something I saw in the film but never mind. We also have a swivelling platform, which can show Barbossa's transformation from man to monster and is again, decent but could have been left out. The chest is really nice I think, I am glad they included a brick-built chest rather than one of those brown two piece treasure chests, which given the look of it in the film, would have been too small and two ornate. We also get a brown rowing boat with oars, which is good as this is the only set with a rowing boat in that colour. They are always very useful as they seem to appear very frequently in all four of the movies.

Summary

Overall, I would put this towards the bottom of you list of sets to purchase from the Pirates of the Caribbean theme. It is not the worst but far from the best. Just an all round simple and decent set. Certainly worth the price for what you get, especially due to the great parts selection. If you want the set for Elizabeth and Barbossa, I would say it is still worth buying as you can simply part out the rest of the set. I would recommend this set and give it...


Overall - 8/10

author: LEGOMaster137
title: I like it...
review:
I like this set but there are a few cons...

Pros

  • Awesome job with Elizabeth!
  • Love the gold in the bag, shiny and actually looks like money!
  • Cool Barbossa and Jack.
  • Clever spin with the Barbossa skeleton change.
  • Very cool poster with it.

Cons

  • No Will, Ragetti, Pintel, or Jack the Monkey! (Even just skeleton pirate could have worked.)
  • Very annoying mast.
  • Jack doesn't have a skeleton body?
  • It needs to be bigger.
I would recommend this to a friend. It has some cons. But I got it because I love the scene and I wanted the exclusive Elizabeth! :-)

author: nerfman1234
title: I feel...old.
review:
This is a fun set based of the climax scene of "Curse of the Black Pearl", the first POTC movie released in 2003. In it, Captain Sparrow must break the curse of the Aztec Gold to get his ship back. You get Cursed Jack Sparrow, Barbossa, Skeleton Barbossa, and Elizabeth Swann. 

Pros

  • The only set to currently feature Regular Barbossa (Not under the order of George) and Elizabeth Swann.
  • A cool rock structure and Aztec Gold reservoir: With glimmering golden pieces!*
  • A simple, yet fun build.
  • The included boat is nice.
  • An interesting way of changing Barbossa into cursed version.
  • The mast that falls with a flick-fire missile type contraption is cool.

Cons


  • It's structurally weak 
  • The collapsing mast has a bar in the middle that annoyingly spins around when played with.


I recommend this set to POTC fans, Collectors, and any other Lego builders.



*Some people did not get the actual gold featured on the box. This is an idiotic decision to save money on Lego's part, but I have heard that from now on, all POTC sets being sent from the Lego Warehouse will include the gold pieces featured on the box, including The London Escape.

author: Rocka_3_0
title: Isle Of The Dead
review:
I bought theis set right when it came out, because I had just watched Curse of the Black Pearl with my freind and... I LOVED IT! I searched every shelf in the whole Lego Isle.

Box/Instructions

Uhh, it's a box, right? Well, a box with awesome boxart!

And it even comes with a poster! It's about time TLG did something like this!

I thought there would be a character card, but it turns out that only the "On Stranger Tides" sets have them. :/

Parts

The parts are simple, there are a few new pieces, including Barbossa's hat, Jack's hair, and the Gold Bars. Speaking of Gold Bars, they are NOT chrome gold like on the box, they are pearl gold, same with the coins.

Minifigures

Jack Sparrow: This version of Jack is exlusive to this set, he has an angry face and on the other side he has a skeleton face.

Hector Barbossa: Barbossa is probably my favorite minifig in the whole set, he has an awesome hat, the same one as the Musketeer Collectable minifig. He also has an apple and a scabbard that you can put his cutlass in the slot by his waist.

Skeleton Barbossa: This fig is my least favorite of the set, he is just like a Ninjago Skullkin with a hat, scabbard and a beard.

Miss Swann: This minifig is not very true to the movie, she is not wearing this dress in this scene. But other than that she is very detailed and has a nice dark red and black color scheme.

The build

The build is not very interesting, but it's still good, with all the gold. >:)

The completed model

It's not the most True-To-The-Movie set, but it works. And I really like the falling ship mast.

The Chest of Cortez' looks pretty good, but should have been gold. It also comes with a rowboat, with is handy.

Summary

I reccomend this set to PotC Fans of all ages!

It's very cool and all the minifigs are exlusive to this set!

author: DarthLuke824
title: Excellent Pirate Starter!
review:
This is my second POTC set as I thought some of the figs might make a welcome addition to my Black Pearl! This is a great set, a mix of parts, wonderful Minifigs (Barbossa!!) and a good set for the price. My only problem is that it nees to be a little bigger, a plate or two would have done nicely! Anyway some good and bad points:

Pros

  • Great figs (All exclusive!)
  • Nice mix of parts for other MOCs
  • Wonderful little boat
  • Gold pieces! (Mine were shiny chrome!)
  • Swords, Hats and other great parts.

Cons

  • More plates needed for sword fighting space.
  • Needs Will Turner or others like Girl Raggeti and Pintel!


Overall a fantastic set with great parts, figures and apart from the cons (Easily fixable) it is worth the price! Buy it even if its not on sale! If you like Pirates and have a spare £20, get it! You won't regret it!


Final score 9/10

author: Snowtrooper119
title: A great set for a great scene
review:
I loved this scene in the movie and I thought that this was really cool when I saw it. Mega bloks made a rubbish version of this scene so I did not buy it and am glad I didn't because this is a lot better.

Box/instructions

The box art on all of the PotC sets are really nice and this is no exception. It makes the set look very nice but there is a problem The box art shows shiny gold coins and bars but in reality they are a pearly gold colour. The instructions are clear and mistake-free and comes with cardboard packaging and plastic bag packaging to keep it in good condition. Inclued in that bag is a poster showing cursed barbossa standing in a puddle fighting normal Jack with will and elizabeth in the background with the chest and some gold. It is a nice poster and will look good on a wall.

Minifigures

The minifigures in this set are really, really good. Hector Barbossa looks fantastic. The detailing on him is superb and looks great. He also has a fantastic hat and a black scabbard. Cursed jack is interesting as he has a unique head with the cursed version on one side and a concentrated face on the other. Elizabeth Swan is another great minifigure with nice colours and a cool hairpiece. Cursed Barbossa is a plain ninjago skeleton with a black scabbard, Barbossa's hat and a white version of Barbossa's head. He is nice and represents the cursed Barbossa well but not as good in as the other one in my opinion. Both Barbossa's have an apple.

 Parts

I really like the parts in this set. The rowboat is a good bit and this set is a cheap way to get one of those spinning pieces. There is lots of bling such as the diamond and the golden chalice. There is also a grooved 2x2round piece on top of the spinning wall.

The build

Was short and standard. No interesting techniques were used and it was all a bit plain but because it was short it couldn't get boring.

The completed model

I really like the completed model. The colours are really cool and everything looks nice together. The spinning wall detracts from the overall look of the set but that is not a biggie. The bling looks really cool alng therock formation and the mast looks great when it is hanging over the cave entrance.

Playability

The playability is pretty good. You can have swordfights between Hector and Jack or have mast collapse over the cave entrance. The spinning wall works well but isn't a neccesity and neither is the mast but I personally like the mast. The only thing it could have would be Pintel or Ragetti but that would drive up the price.

Summary

This set is superior over the mega bloks version and is great set over all. It is not the best but it is certainly better than the shower curtain of youth. This set is better than the fountain of youth in my opinion because it looks good, has a rowboat and has really cool gold details. This isn't the worst and it isn't the best but it is a good set but it is overpriced. I recommend it to fans of the movie, theme and pirates in general. It is a great addition to PotC.
